plugins.name: QR code Maker
plugins.description:
A powerful Figma plugin that lets you generate customizable QR codes with ease. Change colors, add gradients, insert logos, and create unique designs—all while keeping it simple and user-friendly. Export your styled QR codes in high-quality PNG format and enhance your designs effortlessly!


Feature Suggestions:


Prototype QR Code Generator – generate QR codes that link to Figma prototypes, making it easier to share interactive designs with clients or teams.

Design Asset QR Codes – Allow users to generate QR codes that link to downloadable assets or design system documentation.

Social Media Links – Add options to create QR codes linking to social media profiles or portfolios directly from the design canvas.

Customizable Frames – Offer stylish frames or borders around QR codes to make them fit different design aesthetics.

Bulk QR Code Generation – Allow generating multiple QR codes at once for product packaging, business cards, or event badges.
plugins.tagline: Stylize & Export QR Codes – Your Way!

124705.name: QR code Maker
124705.description:

124705.tagline: Stylize & Export QR Codes – Your Way!

plugins.name: Color Frequency Visualizer
plugins.description:
Color Frequency is a powerful plugin for Figma that helps you analyze and visualize the color distribution within your designs. By sorting pixels based on color frequency, the plugin gives you a clear understanding of your design's color balance. It’s perfect for designers looking to ensure harmonious color usage and improve overall design aesthetics.


The plugin can also help you apply the classic 60/30/10 rule of color proportion, ensuring that your primary, secondary, and accent colors are balanced in your design. Whether you’re working on UI designs or visual compositions, Color Frequency helps maintain color harmony and creates visually pleasing layouts with ease.
plugins.tagline: Analyze and visualize color frequencies with precision — organize your designs by the spectrum

115283.name: Color Frequency Visualizer
115283.description:
Color Frequency is a powerful plugin for Figma that helps you analyze and visualize the color distribution within your designs. By sorting pixels based on color frequency, the plugin gives you a clear understanding of your design's color balance. It’s perfect for designers looking to ensure harmonious color usage and improve overall design aesthetics.


The plugin can also help you apply the classic 60/30/10 rule of color proportion, ensuring that your primary, secondary, and accent colors are balanced in your design. Whether you’re working on UI designs or visual compositions, Color Frequency helps maintain color harmony and creates visually pleasing layouts with ease.
115283.tagline: Analyze and visualize color frequencies with precision — organize your designs by the spectrum

plugins.name: Typosys
plugins.description:
Typosys is a Figma plugin designed to simplify and accelerate the creation and management of typography systems.

By selecting a base font and size, you can effortlessly generate styles that scale proportionally. The plugin supports custom naming, font faces, weights, sizes, line heights, and letter spacing. It also introduces a multi-dimensional mode system, allowing you to tailor styles for specific devices like desktop, tablet, and mobile. Once completed, the styles are imported into Figma, fully linked to dynamically generated variable collections.



Benefits


  1. Faster workflow: Set up your typography system in minutes.
  2. Consistent scaling: Styles are proportional to the base size for a cohesive design.
  3. Flexibility: Each style can be individually customized.
  4. Device-specific optimization: Use modes to adjust styles for different screen sizes.
  5. Variable integration: Styles are automatically connected to dynamic Figma variable collections.



Key Features


  1. Base font and size selection
  2. Proportional typography style generation
  3. Customizable font face, weight, size, line-height, and letter-spacing
  4. Mode-based dimensions (Desktop, Tablet, Mobile)
  5. Automatic variable generation and linking
  6. One-click import

accepted.name: Roland Hidvegi
accepted.description: Roland Hidvegi is a Product Designer — crafting digital experiences, from vision to final touches, passionate about creating things that make people happy.

plugins.tagline: Streamline your typography system in seconds.

plugins.name: Conversor de REM a PX
plugins.description:
Simplifica la conversión entre REM y PX con esta herramienta práctica y eficiente. Este plugin es ideal para diseñadores y desarrolladores que trabajan con unidades relativas y absolutas, permitiéndote calcular valores de forma rápida y precisa.


Características Principales

✅ Conversión bidireccional: Convierte fácilmente entre PX y REM, y viceversa.

🎯 Configuración de tamaño base: Personaliza el tamaño base de fuente (default 16px) para adaptarlo a tus proyectos.

💡 Resultados instantáneos: Obtén los resultados con solo un clic.

📋 Copia fácil al portapapeles: Copia los valores resultantes directamente con un botón.

⚡ Interfaz amigable: Diseño limpio e intuitivo que facilita el flujo de trabajo.


¿Cómo usarlo?

  1. Define el tamaño base de la fuente: Ingresa el tamaño base (por ejemplo, 16px).
  2. Ingresa el valor a convertir: Escribe el número en PX o REM.
  3. Selecciona el tipo de conversión: Elige entre PX a REM o REM a PX.
  4. Presiona "CONVERTIR": Obtén el resultado al instante y cópialo si lo necesitas.


🚀 Feedback Bienvenido

Este conversor es un MVP pensado para facilitar tu trabajo diario. ¿Qué más te gustaría incluir? ¡Déjame tus sugerencias y ayuda a que esta herramienta sea aún más útil!
plugins.tagline: Convierte fácil entre px y rem para un diseño más preciso y consistente.

plugins.name: Component Viewer
plugins.description:
Component Viewer Plugin for Figma


Overview: The Component Viewer plugin enhances your design workflow in Figma by providing a quick and easy way to visualize all components and instances present on a page. With a simple button, you can activate or deactivate the highlighting of components, making it easier to manage and review your designs.


Features:

  1. Instant Visualization: Quickly view all components and instances on the current Figma page.
  2. Simple Toggle: Activate or deactivate the highlighting with a single button press. The button is centrally located for easy access.
  3. Custom Highlighting: Components and instances are displayed with a vibrant red fill when activated, making them stand out clearly against the design.
  4. Reset to Default: Deactivating the plugin restores the original appearance of your components, ensuring no permanent changes are made to your design.


User Interface:

  1. Centralized Toggle Button: The intuitive interface features a toggle button with two states:
  2. Activate: Displays components in red with white text.
  3. Deactivate: Returns components to their default state with a light grey background and black text.
  4. Responsive Design: The plugin interface is designed to be clean and user-friendly, ensuring a seamless integration into your Figma environment.


Use Cases:

  1. Perfect for designers looking to audit their components and instances within a project.
  2. Useful for collaborative sessions where multiple team members need to focus on specific design elements.


Installation: Simply select Component Viewer plugin from the Figma plugins menu, and you’re ready to streamline your design process!

accepted.name: Marta IB
accepted.description:
Hola! I am passionate UX designer, who specializes in crafting user experiences that are accessible, thoughtful, and truly enjoyable.
https://martaib.com/

plugins.tagline: Enhance your design flow with Component Viewer—highlight and manage your Figma components easily!

plugins.name: Colorama
plugins.description:
Type in a hex color value and generate a 0-1000 number range for your primitive tokens. Not sure if this should be closer to 100, 200, or somewhere in between? Plug your values into Colorama and get a precise variable name.


Want them on your canvas? Just a click away.


Need your dark color values to be lower on the number scale? Select the direction to flip the number order on light/dark tones. Then click to copy and paste the values into your Figma variables collection.


Run several values at once with a comma separated text string. For example:

#ff0000, #123ABC, #223344
plugins.tagline: A powerful yet simple way to name your design tokens as primitive variables in Figma.

119934.name: Colorama
119934.description:
Type in a hex color value and generate a 0-1000 number range for your primitive tokens. Not sure if this should be closer to 100, 200, or somewhere in between? Plug your values into Colorama and get a precise variable name.


Want them on your canvas? Just a click away.


Need your dark color values to be lower on the number scale? Select the direction to flip the number order on light/dark tones. Then click to copy and paste the values into your Figma variables collection.


Run several values at once with a comma separated text string. For example:

#ff0000, #123ABC, #223344
119934.release_notes: Added the ability to place swatches on the canvas to quickly visualize primitive token names and hex values in one spot.
119934.tagline: A powerful yet simple way to name your design tokens as primitive variables in Figma.

plugins.name: Ephoto Dam
plugins.description:
La source unique pour vos médias !


Pour préparer vos maquettes, rien de plus simple que d'intégrer des médias grâce au plugin Ephoto Dam pour Figma.


Retrouvez directement dans Figma un onglet dédié à votre médiathèque Ephoto Dam. La recherche, vos albums, vos collections et vos mots-clés, autant de fonctions intégrées au plugin pour faciliter votre création graphique.

plugins.name: Just Notes
plugins.description:
✏️ Create & edit notes — Add contextual notes right next to your designs. Edit them anytime to keep your team in the loop.

🎨 Customize your categories — Tailor categories to fit your workflow: rename them, change colors, or add new ones.

📌 Smart object linking — Notes stay linked to the layers they were created for. If things move around, just sync and your notes will snap back into place.


How to use:

To add a note: select an object, fill in the form, click Add note.

To edit a note: click on it, make changes in the form, click Save.
plugins.tagline: Clear notes for seamless handoffs

130211.name: Just Notes
130211.description:

plugins.name: FontChanger by CreativeRafat
plugins.description: FontChanger is a powerful Figma plugin that converts all text fonts in your design into a dynamic font variable. Simply input your desired font, and FontChanger will update all text layers while maintaining flexibility through Figma’s typography system. Save time, stay consistent, and streamline your design workflow effortlessly!
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly transform your Figma fonts with just one click!

plugins.name: Palette Variable Replacer
plugins.description:
🔹 Generate & Replace – Instantly create color palettes ranging from 3 to 11 colors and apply them with one click to your chosen variable collection or variable set.


🔹 Create New Variable Sets – Easily generate comprehensive color shade ranges (50 to 950) and organize them into a new variable set, perfect for design systems and UI consistency.


Whether you're managing a design system, refining UI themes, or simply exploring color variations, Palette Variable Replacer makes it effortless to update and apply color variables in Figma.


🚀 Simplify your color workflow today!

plugins.name: Nong's Content Filler
plugins.description:
Usage:

  1. Fill Specific Content: Select the text that needs to be filled (single or multiple selections), click the type button, and the relevant content will be automatically filled.
  2. Custom Fill: Select the text that needs to be filled (single or multiple selections), enter custom content in the text box (one entry per line), and click the Apply button. The selected text will be automatically filled with the custom content.
  3. Chinese-English Translation: Select the text that needs to be filled (single selection), enter Chinese content in the text box, and click the Translate button. The translated English content will be automatically filled in the selected text.


使用方式：

  1. 填充特定内容：选择需要填充的文字（单个或多个），点击类型按钮，则自动填充相关内容。
  2. 自定义填充：选择需要填充的文字（单个或多个），在文本框内输入自定义内容（每行一个），点击Apply按钮，则自动填充成输入的自定义内容。
  3. 中英翻译：选择需要填充的文字（单个），在文本框内输入中文内容，点击Translate按钮，则翻译好的英文会自动填充到选择的文字上。
plugins.tagline: Quick Fill Content & Translate

  3. Chinese-English Translation: Select the text that needs to be filled (single selection), enter Chinese content in the text box, and click the Translate button. The translated English content will be automatically filled in the selected text.

plugins.name: Color Name Finder
plugins.description:
Ever wondered what your design colors are called? Select a layer, and this plugin tells you the exact name. Make your designs more expressive!


Perfect for every designer, developer, and accessibility experts.


  1. Fast: Instantly find color names
  2. Minimal: Clean, no-clutter UI
  3. Accurate: Precise color name detection



🚀 Upcoming features:

  1. 1-click copy color name
  2. Auto-rename layers by color name


Acknowledgments:

This plugin is powered by Name That Color open source library by Chirag Mehta.

plugins.name: multiple borders
plugins.description:
multiple borders is an easy-to-use Figma plugin that lets you add multiple borders (strokes) to vector shapes and elements.


with multiple borders, you can:

  1. create complex layered border designs
  2. customize each border's color, weight, and type
  3. enhance design flexibility for icons, buttons, and graphic elements
  4. streamline the process of creating intricate border effects


if you have feedback or run into any bugs, dm me on twitter @coleschfr :)


happy designing!
plugins.tagline: add multiple borders to any vector or element

plugins.name: ColorSync by Blader
plugins.description:
Plugin Description


ColorSync by Blader is an advanced tool for designers who need to generate professional color palettes, precise color harmonies, and perfectly balanced gradients. It uses functional algorithms to ensure professional-quality results directly in Figma.


Detailed Feature Breakdown


1. Core Controls


Color Picker


  1. Function: Sets the base color for all harmonies.
  2. Usage: Click to select any hue or manually enter HEX values.


Color Quantity


  1. Function: Controls palette size (1-20 colors).
  2. Pro Tip: Use 3-5 colors for minimalism, 10+ for complex systems.


Color Format


  1. Options: HEX, RGB, HSL.
  2. Function: Toggles value display (e.g., #FF5733 → rgb(255, 87, 51) → hsl(12, 100%, 60%)).


Dark/Light Mode


  1. Function: Optimizes UI for low-light or bright environments.


2. Harmony Types


  1. Each option uses color theory principles:


Complementary


  1. What it does: Creates 2 opposing colors (180° apart).
  2. Best for: Maximum contrast (CTAs, alerts).


Analogous


  1. What it does: Generates 3-5 adjacent colors (30° increments).
  2. Best for: Harmonious designs (branding, backgrounds).


Tints, Shades & Tones


  1. What it does: Produces luminosity/saturation variations (+20% tints, -20% shades).
  2. Best for: Design systems needing consistent scales.


Compound


  1. What it does: Blends complementary + analogous colors (4-6 colors).
  2. Best for: Data viz, illustrations requiring depth.


3. Output Sections


Generated Palette


  1. Content: Displays colors based on your settings.
  2. Pro Tip: Click any swatch to copy its value.


Color Buttons


  1. Function: Compact palette for quick design integration.


Gradient Generator


  1. What it does: Creates CSS-ready gradients from your palette.
  2. Usage: Copy/paste directly into Figma styles or CSS.


4. Advanced Features


Multilingual Support


  1. English, Spanish, and Chinese localization.


Smart Copy


On click:


  1. Shows "Copied!" confirmation
  2. Auto-formats to selected color space


Professional Use Cases


  1. UI Design: Build component libraries with perfect contrast ratios.
  2. Branding: Test logo color combinations instantly.
  3. Illustration: Find coherent shadow/light palettes.
  4. Presentations: Create slide decks with harmonious schemes.


Sample Workflow


  1. Set corporate blue (#2E86AB) as base color.


  1. Select "Compound" harmony with 6 colors.
  2. Copy the auto-generated gradient for hero banners.
  3. Export HSL values for design documentation.
plugins.tagline: Pro-grade color harmonies & palettes in one click

125716.name: ColorSync by Blader

plugins.name: KeyFinder
plugins.description:
KeyFinder simplifies the process of retrieving and copying Figma component keys.


Features


Flexible Scope Selection: Choose from three options:

  1. Current Selection: Displays keys and names for your selected components and component sets.
  2. Current Page: Retrieves all components and component sets on the active page.
  3. Entire File: Accesses components and component sets across your whole Figma file.

Component Set: Option to include or exclude component sets in your results.

One-Click Copy: Quickly copy the displayed component information to your clipboard for easy sharing.

Clear Visualisation: View component keys alongside their names for easy reference.

accepted.name: Kaio Batista
accepted.description: The world's a roller coaster and I'm not strapped in

plugins.name: BatchGen
plugins.description:
BatchGen: Effortlessly Populate Your Figma Designs with Realistic Content


BatchGen is a powerful Figma plugin designed to help designers quickly generate and update content in bulk. Whether it’s names, numbers, addresses, emails, company names, or ratings, BatchGen brings dynamic, customizable data directly into your Figma projects, saving you time and streamlining your workflow.


Key Features:


•Batch Update: Select multiple text layers or search within groups to quickly batch update content.

•Random Numbers: Generate random numbers with optional prefixes to create custom combinations.

•Random Names: Create realistic names (first, last, or full) with options for prefixes and gender.

•Random Dates: Generate dates within a specified range in your preferred format.


Pro Features:


Unlock premium content generation for even more customization:


•Addresses: Generate complete addresses, including postal codes, cities, and countries.

•Emails: Create random email addresses with customizable formats and domains.

•Numbers: Define ranges, formats, and prefixes for random number generation.

•Company Names: Generate unique company names based on industry and location preferences.

•Monetary Values: Create realistic currency values with customizable ranges and currencies.

•Ratings & Scores: Generate ratings in stars, percentages, or decimals with customizable ranges.


BatchGen is the perfect tool for designers who want to enhance their workflow and bring designs to life with ease.
plugins.tagline: Ultimate Content Generation Tool for Figma

117757.name: BatchGen
117757.description:

117757.release_notes:
BatchGen Release Notes – [Version 2.1]

Release Date: 31/1/2025

🚀 Improvements
•      Security Enhancements: Strengthened data handling and storage to ensure better protection of sensitive information.
•Performance Optimisations: Faster generation of content, reducing processing time and improving overall efficiency.

🛠 Bug Fixes
•Resolved an issue where certain random generation fields were not updating correctly.
•Fixed UI glitches that occasionally caused misalignment in generated content.
•Improved stability when handling large-scale batch operations.
117757.tagline: Ultimate Content Generation Tool for Figma

plugins.name: Check Contrast
plugins.description:
Color Contrast Checker: Enhance Visibility, Ensure Accessibility


Elevate your design standards with our Color Contrast Checker—a vital tool for creating visually accessible and user-friendly digital content.


How to use:

  1. Select any 2 colors or layers
  2. Check the contrast
  3. Make changes if required
  4. Apply the changes


Color Contrast Checker is more than just a tool; it's a commitment to inclusive design. By ensuring that your content is readable and accessible, you enhance the user experience for all individuals, including those with visual disabilities. Prioritize accessibility in your design process and make a positive impact on your audience with our easy-to-use and effective contrast evaluation tool.


--

Any feedback is welcome at datta.prianko@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Enhance Visibility, Ensure Accessibility

plugins.name: Token Loader
plugins.description:
Generate a `tokens.json` using something like Style Dictionary.


example tokens.json:


[
{
"name": "core/color/black",
"value": "#000000"
},
{
"name": "alias/color/black",
"value": "#000000",
"aliasOf": "core/color/black"
}
]


Typescript types for the tokens:


interface VariableToken {
name: string; // an/example/name
value: unknown;
}

interface AliasToken extends VariableToken {
aliasOf: VariableToken['name'];
}

type Token = VariableToken | AliasToken;


Next, you can drop in that tokens.json on the plugin window to automatically generate tokens.


Note! It will drop unused ones from the collection, and update existing.
plugins.tagline: A plugin to load tokens (from StyleDictionary), and convert them in to Local Variables

98931.name: Token Loader
98931.description:
Generate a `tokens.json` using something like Style Dictionary.


example tokens.json:


[
{
"name": "core/color/black",
"value": "#000000"
},
{
"name": "alias/color/black",
"value": "#000000",
"aliasOf": "core/color/black"
}
]


Typescript types for the tokens:


interface VariableToken {
name: string; // an/example/name
value: unknown;
}

interface AliasToken extends VariableToken {
aliasOf: VariableToken['name'];
}

type Token = VariableToken | AliasToken;


Next, you can drop in that tokens.json on the plugin window to automatically generate tokens.


Note! It will drop unused ones from the collection, and update existing.
98931.tagline: A plugin to load tokens (from StyleDictionary), and convert them in to Local Variables

plugins.name: Protege AI
plugins.description:
Protege AI for Figma: Legal Compliance, Simplified

Contact founders@protegecounsel.ai to get a trial account.


In the dynamic realm of marketing, aligning content with legal standards is crucial yet challenging. Protege AI for Figma is crafted to empower in-house legal teams, offering a robust tool to review marketing materials quickly and effectively. This Figma plugin integrates flawlessly into your design workflow, using advanced AI to identify and highlight legal concerns in real time.


Key Features:


  1. Automated Content Analysis: Deploy state-of-the-art AI to scan designs for legal issues like copyright infringement, regulatory non-compliance, and sensitive language.
  2. Real-Time Feedback: Instantly receive suggestions and edits within Figma, enabling swift adjustments and compliance checks.
  3. Customizable Legal Libraries: Adjust the AI’s scanning abilities to match your specific legal standards and requirements, ensuring a tailored and relevant review.
  4. Collaborative Review Process:** Enhance cooperation between legal and marketing teams with in-document comments and edits, making the review and approval process smoother.
  5. Comprehensive Reporting:** Produce in-depth reports on the legal review process, including issues identified and resolutions, for compliance tracking and audit trails.


Benefits:


  1. Save Time and Resources: Significantly cut down on the time dedicated to reviewing marketing materials, freeing your legal team for more strategic tasks.
  2. Enhance Accuracy: Reduce the risk of missing legal issues with the AI’s detailed analysis.
  3. Improve Collaboration: Foster a more efficient and collaborative relationship between your legal and marketing departments.
  4. Ensure Compliance: Keep up with changes in regulations with an AI tool that adapts to new legal standards.


Ideal For:


  1. In-house legal teams aiming to enhance the review of marketing content directly within Figma.
  2. Marketing teams looking to accelerate compliance and mitigate legal risks in their creative.
  3. Legal professionals seeking to utilize technology for more efficient and integrated workflows.
plugins.tagline: Protege AI: Streamline Legal Reviews for Creative & Marketing

plugins.name: PinNote
plugins.description:
Comunique com clareza. Colabore com eficiência.

Com o PinNote, você pode adicionar notas diretamente nos elementos do design. Cada nota pode ser classificada por categorias inteligentes como Acessibilidade, Desenvolvimento, Interações, Bug Report, Regra de Negócio, entre outras. Cada categoria oferece recursos específicos, como trechos de código, mensagens para leitores de tela, descrição de interações e links.


O plugin também permite criar categorias personalizadas com ícones e cores definidas por você! As notas são organizadas automaticamente, com posicionamento inteligente e numeração visual, facilitando a leitura mesmo em arquivos complexos.



Para quem é esse plugin?

O PinNote foi criado para:

  1. Product Designers que querem entregar projetos mais claros, documentados e colaborativos.
  2. UX/UI Designers que precisam deixar orientações específicas sobre interações, regras de negócio e acessibilidade.
  3. Desenvolvedores que desejam encontrar rapidamente tudo o que precisam para implementar uma interface com fidelidade.
  4. Líderes de produto e stakeholders que querem acompanhar decisões de design com transparência.
  5. Times multidisciplinares que buscam reduzir fricções no processo de handoff e ganhar eficiência.



FAQ - Perguntas Frequentes

Como faço para mover uma nota depois de criada?

R: As notas podem ser movidas normalmente como qualquer outro elemento do Figma. Basta selecionar e arrastar para a nova posição. O indicador numérico permanecerá vinculado ao elemento original.


É possível editar uma nota existente?

R: Sim, basta dar duplo clique na nota para abrir o modo de edição. Você pode modificar título, descrição, código e outros campos. A tag principal não pode ser alterada para manter a consistência.


Como funciona a numeração automática?

R: A numeração é sequencial por elemento. Quando você habilita a numeração, o plugin mantém um contador global e atribui o próximo número disponível. A numeração persiste mesmo se você deletar notas intermediárias.


As cores das tags são personalizáveis?

R: Cada tag tem uma cor padrão otimizada para legibilidade, mas elas podem ser alteradas de acordo com as preferências do usuário. As tags estão definidas por default como:

- Acessibilidade: #00EEFF

- Desenvolvimento: #55EF71

- Nota: #F9E444

- Alterações: #FF9925

- Regra de negócio: #CD79F4

- Interações: #FF5959

- Bug report: #FF59C8


Existe um limite de notas por elemento?

R: Não há limite técnico, mas por questões de organização e legibilidade, recomendamos não criar mais que 3-4 notas por elemento.


Como as notas são organizadas quando há várias no mesmo elemento?

R: O plugin posiciona as notas automaticamente, primeiro tentando à direita e depois abaixo das notas existentes, mantendo um espaçamento de 16px entre elas.


O plugin funciona com componentes do Figma?

R: Sim, o plugin funciona com qualquer elemento selecionável do Figma, incluindo componentes, instâncias, grupos e frames.


Outros usuários podem ver minhas notas?

R: Sim, as notas são visíveis para todos que têm acesso ao arquivo do Figma. O nome do autor e timestamp são preservados para manter o histórico.


É possível comentar em notas existentes?

R: Atualmente não há sistema de comentários nas notas, mas você pode usar o sistema de comentários nativo do Figma para discutir sobre uma nota específica ou editar o conteúdo da nota.


Posso criar tags personalizadas?

R: Sim, usando a opção "Personalizado" você pode definir sua própria cor e ícone para a tag. As configurações são salvas para reutilização.


Quais idiomas o PinNote suporta?

R: O PinNote possui suporte para os idiomas português (padrão), inglês e espanhol, permitindo que você utilize o plugin no idioma que preferir.


Posso desativar a exibição do nome do autor e da data nas notas?

R: Sim! É possível ocultar o nome do autor e a data de criação das notas através do botão mais opções, deixando a visualização mais limpa conforme sua necessidade.


Dá para desativar a criação dos marcadores numéricos nas notas?

R: Sim, você pode desativar a criação dos indicadores, através do botão mais opções, para que as notas fiquem sem numeração visual, caso prefira um layout mais simples.


Como personalizar as cores das tags?

R: Você pode escolher cores diferentes das definidas por padrão para as tags. O PinNote sugere cores acessíveis, alinhadas às diretrizes WCAG, para garantir boa legibilidade. Além disso, é possível inserir qualquer cor personalizada usando códigos hexadecimais, acessando a opção “mais cores”.
plugins.tagline: Facilite a comunicação no Figma com notas visuais que destacam informações importantes no seu design

135414.name: PinNote
135414.description:

R: Sim, as notas são visíveis para todos que têm acesso ao arquivo do Figma. O nome do autor e timestamp são preservados para manter o histórico.


É possível comentar em notas existentes?

R: Atualmente não há sistema de comentários nas notas, mas você pode usar o sistema de comentários nativo do Figma para discutir sobre uma nota específica ou editar o conteúdo da nota.


Posso criar tags personalizadas?

R: Sim, usando a opção "Personalizado" você pode definir sua própria cor e ícone para a tag. As configurações são salvas para reutilização.


Quais idiomas o PinNote suporta?

R: O PinNote possui suporte para os idiomas português (padrão), inglês e espanhol, permitindo que você utilize o plugin no idioma que preferir.


Posso desativar a exibição do nome do autor e da data nas notas?

R: Sim! É possível ocultar o nome do autor e a data de criação das notas através do botão mais opções, deixando a visualização mais limpa conforme sua necessidade.


Dá para desativar a criação dos marcadores numéricos nas notas?

R: Sim, você pode desativar a criação dos indicadores, através do botão mais opções, para que as notas fiquem sem numeração visual, caso prefira um layout mais simples.


Como personalizar as cores das tags?

R: Você pode escolher cores diferentes das definidas por padrão para as tags. O PinNote sugere cores acessíveis, alinhadas às diretrizes WCAG, para garantir boa legibilidade. Além disso, é possível inserir qualquer cor personalizada usando códigos hexadecimais, acessando a opção “mais cores”.
135414.tagline: Facilite a comunicação no Figma com notas visuais que destacam informações importantes no seu design

plugins.name: Ten Tone - Color Generator
plugins.description:
Ten Toneは、あなたのカラーワークフローを劇的に効率化するFigmaプラグインです。


・10段階カラースケール生成

任意のベースカラーから、Mantine風の美しい10段階のカラースケールを瞬時に作成。明るい色から暗い色までバランス良く調整され、デザインの一貫性を保ちます。複数のベースカラーを指定して、一度にまとめて生成することも可能です。


・色相バリエーション生成

ベースカラーの彩度と明度を維持したまま、赤・青・緑など様々な色相のバリエーションを簡単に探求できます。アクセントカラーやテーマカラーの検討に最適です。


UIデザイン、グラフィックデザイン、資料作成など、あらゆる場面でのカラーパレット選定と配色作業を、より直感的かつスピーディーに。

Ten Toneで、色の可能性を最大限に引き出しましょう。」
plugins.tagline: カラーシステム構築を加速。スケール＆色相バリエーション生成。

plugins.name: Clean Gradients
plugins.description:
Problem:

When using a standard gradient with two colors, if there is a large gap between their tones, the saturation in the middle decreases significantly, and the color in this area may appear grayish-resulting in a «muddy» shade.


Solution:

With just two clicks, the plugin eliminates the «muddy» effect in the middle of the gradient by adding three additional intermediate color stops.


How to use the plugin:

1. The colors for the initial gradient can be taken either from an existing gradient element by selecting it and clicking the «Pick gradient» button or by using the «Color Picker» tool on the left and right of the button.

2. To apply the gradient, select the desired element and click the «Apply gradient» button.
plugins.tagline: Cleans the gradient from «dirt»

121505.name: Clean Gradients
121505.description:

2. To apply the gradient, select the desired element and click the «Apply gradient» button.

plugins.name: ThumbSpan
plugins.description:
ThumbSpan helps you determine which UI elements

are particularly hard to reach with the thumb while using

the phone one-handed.


The Area of Reach of the thumb has been based on empirical evidence, sourced from academic studies. Please see the last picture for the current supported one-handed phone positions, more to be added soon...


How Does it Work

  1. ThumbSpan adds a gradient Layer to your frames.
  2. It is recommended to apply it on a copy of the frame
  3. The Copy should not have any Auto Layout.
  4. It allows you to select Opacity and Hand Position
  5. It also allows you to select between Left and Right Hand
  6. These Layers can be cascaded - applied one after another (You can apply it for both Left and Right hand together)




This Plugin is still in Beta, Please send any bug reports and feature requests to my email: its.shahab.khan10@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Check which parts of your UI within the average thumbspan

plugins.name: Component Crafter
plugins.description:
Quickly and easily create and manage your components


Features


1.Create Components or Component Sets

Convert any selected layers into components or component sets, with an option to replace them with their instances.


2.Add layers Directly to Existing Components


3.Replace with Component Instances

Swap selected layers with component instances for better design consistency.


4.Advanced Selection Options

Select layers by shared properties before converting them into components.


5.Clone as New Components


6.Instance Management

  1. Select instances on the current page.
  2. Detach instances on the page or across the file.


7.Detach Components

Break components into editable layers while preserving their appearance.


8.Decompose a Component


9.Multi-Language Support
plugins.tagline: Quickly and easily create and manage your components

plugins.name: Change Text Field by ID
plugins.description:
A very simple plugin allowing you to set the text of a figma Text element by referencing it's internal node ID.

One way you can get the node ID of your text elements is by fetching your figma 'file' layout data via the figma file API end-point: https://api.figma.com/v1/files/${FIGMA_FILE_KEY}

Then look for your text element and identify it's corresponding ID field.

Else you could try using the 'Text node name to id' plugin.
plugins.tagline: Set the text of a Text element by referencing its node ID

plugins.name: Colour Scale Generator
plugins.description:
Design smarter colour systems in seconds. This plugin lets you enter a HEX value and instantly creates a vertical stack of Tailwind-style shades (from 50–950) as Figma rectangles. Ideal for UI designers building design systems, checking contrast, or quickly visualising accessible palettes — powered by Chroma.js logic, all inside Figma.

Created by Salo Creative.

accepted.name: Carl Cahill
accepted.description: UX/UI Designer, Creative Director and Agency Founder

plugins.tagline: Generate accessible, Tailwind-style colour scales directly in Figma — just enter a HEX code.
